==Japanese==

===Kanji===
{{ja-kanji|grade=|rs=牙00}}

# [[tusk]], [[fang]]

====Readings====
{{ja-readings
|goon=[[げ]] (ge)
|kanon=[[が]] (ga)
|kun=[[きば]] (kiba), [[き]] (ki), [[かび]] (kabi) {{non-joyo-reading}}, [[は]] (ha) {{non-joyo-reading}}
}}

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|き}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=き}}. Appears in the ''[[w:Man'yōshū|Man'yōshū]]''.<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|き}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|き}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=き|obsolete}} [[fang]], [[tusk]], [[tooth]] {{qualifier|particularly the [[canine]]}}
#* {{RQ:Manyoshu|9|1809}}; [http://etext.lib.virginia.edu/japanese/manyoshu/Man9Yos.html#1809 text here]
#*: {{lang|ja|'''牙'''喫建怒而}}
#*:: {{lang|ja|'''き'''かみたけびて}}
#*:: '''''ki''' kami takebite''
#*::: ferociously gnashing '''teeth'''

=====Usage notes=====
Although this term is no longer used in isolation, it does persist in certain compounds.

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|牙噛む|きがむ}}: to [[gnash]] one's [[teeth]]
* {{ja-r|牙骨|きぼね}}: the [[jawbone]], the [[mandible]], the [[lower jaw]]
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|きば}}
Compound of {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=きば}} elements {{compound|lang=ja|sort=きば|牙|tr1=ki|t1=fang, tusk|歯|tr2=ha|t2=tooth}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> {{rendaku2|sort=きば|ha|ba}}

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|きば|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|きば}}

# [[fang]], [[tusk]], [[tooth]] {{qualifier|particularly the [[canine]]s}}
# {{lb|ja|sort=きば|falconry}} [[dog]] {{qualifier|primarily used for counting hunting dogs}}

=====Usage notes=====
This is the most common term for {{m|en|fang}} in modern Japanese.

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|牙上面|きば じょうめん}}: [[ivory]] or [[boar]] [[tusk]] used to [[rub]] the [[surface]] of a [[print]] in order to bring out the [[gloss]]
* {{ja-r|牙筍貝|きば たけがい}}: a kind of [[auger snail]] of [[family]] ''{{taxlink|Terebridae|family|noshow=1}}''
* {{ja-r|牙獐|きば のろ}}: the “fanged ''noro''”, a kind of [[roe deer]] of [[genus]] ''[[Capreolus]]''
{{der-bottom}}

=====Idioms=====
{{der-top|Idioms}}
* {{ja-r|牙を噛む|きば を かむ}}: “to bite one's fangs” → to [[gnash]] one's [[teeth]]
* {{ja-r|牙を研ぐ|きば を とぐ}}: “to sharpen one's fangs” → to [[prepare]] to [[hurt]] one's [[opponent]]. Compare [[sharpen one's claws]]
* {{ja-r|牙を鳴らす|きば を ならす}}: “to clash one's fangs” → to [[gnash]] one's [[teeth]]; to get [[angry]]; to [[bare]] one's [[fang]]s
* {{ja-r|牙を剥く|きば を むく}}: “to bare one's fangs”
* {{ja-r|牙あるものは角無し|きば ある もの は つの なし}}: “the one with fangs has no horns” → a [[metaphor]] for how no one is [[endow]]ed with every [[advantage]]
{{der-bottom}}

=====See also=====
* {{ja-r|門歯|もんし}}: [[incisor]] tooth
* {{ja-r|犬歯|けんし}}: [[canine tooth]]
* {{ja-r|小臼歯|しょうきゅうし}}: [[premolar]]
* {{ja-r|臼歯|きゅうし}}: [[molar]]
* {{ja-r|象牙|ぞうげ}}: [[elephant]] [[tusk]], [[ivory]]

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|かび}}
Cognate with, and probably the noun derivation of, verb {{m|ja|黴びる|tr=kabiru||to go moldy}}, from the root idea of something [[sprout]]ing.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> Used in the ''[[w:Kojiki|Kojiki]]''.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|かび}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かび}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=かび|obsolete}} a plant [[sprout]], a plant [[bud]]

=====Derived terms=====
* {{ja-r|葦牙|あしかび}}: a [[reed]] [[sprout]] or [[bud]]

===Etymology 4===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|は}}
Non-standard alternate spelling for {{m|ja|歯|tr=ha||tooth}}.<ref name="KDJ"/>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|は}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|は}}

# {{alternative spelling of|lang=ja|sort=は|歯|dot=:}} [[tooth]]

===Etymology 5===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|げ}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=げ}} {{m|zh|牙|tr=ngæ}}. Compare modern {{etyl|nan|-}} reading ''ge<sup>5</sup>''.

The ''[[呉音#Japanese|goon]]'' reading, so probably the reading as first imported into Japanese.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|げ}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|げ}}

# an [[animal]]'s [[fang]] or [[tusk]]
# an [[elephant]]'s [[tusk]]: [[ivory]]
# a [[tooth]]

=====Usage notes=====
The {{m|en|tooth}} meaning is much more commonly expressed using the word {{m|ja|歯|tr=ha}}.

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|牙の笏|げ の しゃく}}: an [[ivory]] [[mace]] or [[scepter]], used by certain social classes in ancient Japan
* {{ja-r|牙歯|げし}}: teeth, tusks, or fangs
* {{ja-r|牙軸|げじく}}: the inner edge of a scroll around which the scroll is [[wound]], or an edge of a folding book to which pages are [[bound]], made of [[ivory]]
* {{ja-l|牙床}}, {{ja-l|牙象|げしょう|geshō}}: a kind of [[cutout]] [[decorative]] [[carving]] technique for [[panel]]s, wherein the corners are left intact to reinforce the structure of the panel
* {{ja-r|牙彫|げぼり}}: a [[carving]] made from a [[tusk]] or [[fang]], more specifically made of [[elephant]] [[ivory]]
* {{ja-r|牙笏|げしゃく}}: an [[ivory]] [[mace]] or [[scepter]], used by certain social classes in ancient Japan
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 6===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|が}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=が}} {{m|zh|牙|tr=ngæ}}. Compare modern {{etyl|yue|-}} reading ''ngaa<sup>4</sup>''.

The ''[[漢音#Japanese|kan'on]]'' reading, so probably a later importation.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|が}}

====Affix====
{{ja-pos|affix|が}}

# an [[animal]]'s [[fang]] or [[tusk]]
# an [[elephant]]'s [[tusk]]: [[ivory]]
# a [[tooth]]

=====Usage notes=====
The ''ga'' reading is only used in compounds, and is never used in isolation.

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|牙営|がえい}}: the [[headquarters]] of a general in a field camp
* {{ja-r|牙音|がおん}}: a [[velar consonant]] {{qualifier|obsolete}}
* {{ja-r|牙関緊急|がかん きんきゅう}}: [[lockjaw]], a common [[symptom]] in the early stages of [[tetanus]]
* {{ja-r|牙旗|がき}}: a [[flag]] raised at the site of an [[emperor]]'s or [[general]]'s field camp
* {{ja-r|牙行|がこう}}: in China, a [[middleman]] or [[go-between]] in a [[commercial]] [[transaction]]
* {{ja-r|牙山|^がざん}}: the city of [[w:Asan|Asan]], a [[port]] in [[w:South Korea|South Korea]]
* {{ja-r|牙商|がしょう}}: a [[middleman]] or [[go-between]] in a [[commercial]] [[transaction]]
* {{ja-r|牙城|がじょう}}: the [[keep]] or main [[residence]] within a [[castle]]; a [[headquarters]], a [[base]], a [[stronghold]]
* {{ja-r|牙人|がじん}}: in China, a [[middleman]] or [[go-between]] in a [[commercial]] [[transaction]]
* {{ja-r|牙銭|がせん}}: a [[fee]] or [[commission]] charged by a {{ja-l|牙行||gakō}}
* {{ja-r|牙虫|がむし}}: a [[water scavenger beetle]] of [[family]] ''{{taxlink|Hydrophilidae|family|noshow=1}}''
* {{ja-r|牙斧|がふ}}: a small [[axe]] or [[hatchet]] made from [[boar]] [[tusk]]
* {{ja-r|牙保|がほ}}: a [[middleman]] or [[go-between]] in a [[commercial]] [[transaction]]
* {{ja-r|牙保罪|がほざい}}: the [[crime]] of [[fencing]] goods known to be [[stolen]]
* {{ja-r|牙保犯|がほはん}}: the [[crime]] of [[fencing]] goods known to be [[stolen]]
* {{ja-r|牙門|がもん}}: a [[gate]] on which a [[general]]'s [[flag]] is flying; an army's [[headquarters]]
* {{ja-r|牙籌|がちゅう}}: an [[abacus]]; more specifically, an [[ivory]] abacus
* {{ja-l|牙籤}}, {{ja-l|牙籖|がせん|gasen}}: a small [[placard]] or [[label]] made of [[ivory]]; a small [[claw]]-shaped ivory [[clasp]] for holding a [[book]] closed
* {{ja-r|牙纛|がとう}}: the [[flag]] of a [[general]]'s [[army]], the [[pole]] of which was traditionally decorated with [[ivory]] on the end
* {{ja-r|牙儈|がかい}}: in China, a [[middleman]] or [[go-between]] in a [[commercial]] [[transaction]]
{{der-bottom}}
